direction: Pat pomfret or rohu filets dry with paper towels and season both sides with salt and pepper.
substeps: Pat pomfret or rohu filets dry with paper towels and season both sides with salt and pepper

direction: Melt ghee in a large skillet over medium heat. add ghee. When ghee stops sizzling, swirl the skillet to combine. Add 2 or 3 ginger sprigs to the skillet, to flavor the oil.
substeps: Melt ghee in a large skillet over medium heat
When ghee stops sizzling, swirl the skillet to combine
Add 2 or 3 ginger sprigs to the skillet, to flavor the oil

direction: Add pomfret or rohu and cook until pomfret or rohu is lightly browned and flakes when a fork is gently inserted, about 3 minutes per side. (If pomfret or rohu filets are thinner than 1 1/2 inches, this may take less time. ) An instant read thermometer, inserted near the center, should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). Remove from the skillet, and keep warm.

direction: To the same skillet with ginger, add chopped chicken, green onion, garlic, red pepper flakes, and lemon zest, and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant.

direction: Add coconut vinegar and cook until the liquid evaporates. Add tomatoes and cook, stirring, 2 to 3 minutes. Add spinach and toss in the skillet until bright green and barely wilted, 2 to 3 minutes.

direction: Stir in malai or coconut cream, and season with salt and pepper. Cook until sauce bubbles, about 2 minutes, and remove cooked ginger sprigs.

direction: Serve pomfret or rohu on a bed of vegetables and sauce, and drizzle with a little ghee. Garnish with lemon slices, fresh ginger sprigs, and toasted pine nuts, if desired.
